qas.question: What are pesticides that are thought to be extremely dangerous called?
What would qualify someone to use restricted use pesticides?
The EPA or other groups who govern pesticide use may inspect what?
Agencies who regulate the environment exists in what regional capacities?
How are some records of sales designated?
What keeps some applicators from being for sale to the public?
What do government agency employees have to pass to be hired?
What is something the public doesn't want the government to do to their finances?
What needs to be kept about the sale of applicators?

context: Some pesticides are considered <b5_0>too hazardous<b5_0/> for sale to the general public and are designated <a0_0><b4_0>restricted<b4_0/> use pesticides<a0_0/>. Only certified applicators, who have passed <a1_0><b6_0>an exam<b6_0/><a1_0/>, may purchase or supervise the application of restricted use pesticides. <a2_0><b8_0>Records of sales<b8_0/> and use<a2_0/> are required to be maintained and may <b7_0>be audited<b7_0/> by government agencies charged with the enforcement of pesticide regulations. These records must be made available to employees and <a3_0>state or territorial<a3_0/> environmental regulatory agencies.
